chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anna M Littlepaige appeared by video.  Attorney Matt Ricci appeared by video for Anna M Littlepaige.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer L. Christianson. State rest. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 28. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anna M Littlepaige in court.  Attorney Matt Ricci in court for Anna M Littlepaige.  Attorney Matthew James Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has just been appointed as to this case.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Anna M Littlepaige appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anna M Littlepaige in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anna M Littlepaige in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anna M Littlepaige in court by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anna M Littlepaige in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
